724508f-a.text:
(1)
1229-147 West Houston Street, south side, from Sullivan to Macdougal Streets, a solid block of six-story tenement houses. Along with the rest of the south side of Houston Street, from Broadway to Sixth Avenue, these buildings are shortly to be demolished.
July 17, 1929.
L. Sperr.
(2)
Window of an Italian bakery at 133-135 West Houston Street, adjoining the S.W. corner of Sullivan Street, a detail of one of the building included in the above view of 129-147 West
Houston Street.
July 17, 1929.
L. Sperr.
724508f-a.folder: Houston Street (West & Sullivan Street, Manhattan, NY

(1)
1229-147 West Houston Street, south side, from Sullivan to Macdougal Streets, a solid block of six-story tenement houses. Along with the rest of the south side of Houston Street, from Broadway to Sixth Avenue, these buildings are shortly to be demolished.

724508f-b.folder: Houston Street (West & Sullivan Street, Manhattan, NY

723466f-a.text:
Church of St. Anthony of Padua, 157-153 Sullivan Street, adjoining the cleared S.E. corner of Houston Street (q.v.). This church edifice dates from between 1879 and 1885, but the church was organized in 1805, and later took over the former Free Congregational Church at 149-151 Sullivan Street adjoining, where the six-story tenement house is shown in this view. The site of the present church was occupied by a brewery. St. Anthony of Padua was the first Italian Roman Catholic congregation to be organized in New York. An unsuccessful attenpt to do something for the Italians of New York
had been made in 1859.
June 15, 1930.
L. Sperr.
723466f-a.folder: Sullivan Street & Houston Street, Manhattan, NY

724509f-a.text:
130-144 West Houston Street, north side, from Sullivan Street towards MacDougal Street. No. 132, adjoining the corner at the right, has been recently rebuilt, but the others are substantially the original block of low houses, set back a little from the sidewalk. Around 1910 this block was known as Ludlow Place. The original front stoops have almost all been removed and the basements remodelled into stores.
February 20, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
724509f-a.folder: Houston Street (West) & Sullivan Street., Manhattan, NY
